data.text: Desire not a multitude of unprofitable children,
Though they multiply, rejoice not in them,
Trust not thou in their life,
For by one that hath understanding shall the city be replenished:
Many such things have I seen with mine eyes,
In the congregation of the ungodly shall a fire be kindled;
He was not pacified toward the old giants,
Neither spared he the place where Lot sojourned,
He pitied not the people of perdition,
Nor the six hundred thousand footmen,
And if there be one stiff-necked among the people,
As his mercy is great, so is his correction also:
The sinner shall not escape with his spoils:
Make way for every work of mercy:
Say not thou, I will hide myself from the Lord:
Behold, the heaven, and the heaven of heavens,
The mountains also and foundations of the earth
No heart can think upon these things worthily:
It is a tempest which no man can see:
Who can declare the works of his justice? or who can endure them?
He that wanteth understanding will think upon vain things:
My son, hearken unto me, and learn knowledge,
I will show forth doctrine in weight,
The works of the Lord are done in judgment from the beginning:
He garnished his works forever,
None of them hindereth another,
After this the Lord looked upon the earth,
With all manner of living things hath he covered the face thereof;
